title: Untitled
provenance_text:
Mark Tobey [1890-1976], Seattle, WA [1]; WIllard Gallery, New York, NY [2]; purchased by Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, October 1961 [3].

Notes:
[1]. The catalogue entry for the 1961 Carnegie International (note [2] below) refers to the artist as living "temporarily" in Switzerland. 
[2]. The painting was included (no. 399, illustrated in the catalogue) in "The 1961 Pittsburgh International Exhibition of Contemporary Painting and Sculpture" held at Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, October 1961 - January 1962. It was lent by WIllard Gallery. However, the painting was shipped to the Institute for the exhibition the previous year (in April 1960) from Seligman Gallery, Seattle, WA (see correspondence in curatorial file.)
[3]. The painting was awarded First Prize for Painting at the 1961 International. It was purchased by Carnegie Institute and accessioned on October 17, 1961. Payment to Willard Gallery was sent on November 24, 1961.
